Titre: McPhy Energy Accelerates Development, Appoints Sales Manager for Americas, Britain - PR Newswire
Contenu:
GRENOBLE, France, May 21, 2013 /PRNewswire/ --

Diana de Rosmini joins solid hydrogen pioneer to pursue growth opportunities in industrial, renewable energy and electro-mobility infrastructure markets

McPhy Energy, a leading developer and manufacturer of solid state hydrogen storage and electrolyzers, today announced the appointment of Diana de Rosmini as Sales Manager for the Americas, Great Britain and Key Accounts globally. De Rosmini joins McPhy from Air Liquide, where she held positions in some of the group's most innovative programs related to hydrogen, energy and other environmental technologies.

(Logo: http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20120723/546191 )



(Logo: http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20130521/614066 )



"Diana de Rosmini has a strong understanding of international hydrogen, energy and environmental markets," says Adamo Screnci, Executive Vice President of Sales, member of the management team and president of McPhy Energy's Italian subsidiary. "McPhy is gaining significant traction in key projects worldwide. Diana will bring her deep expertise and energetic approach to our continued expansion and the development of major accounts in merchant hydrogen, electro-mobility and renewable energy markets."

A native of Bolivia and Italy, de Rosmini has a Masters degree in Environmental Engineering from the Polytechnic Institute of Milan, and over eight years prior experience in Environmental Consultancy and with the Air Liquide Group. She started in the Air Liquide Merchant Division in environmental intelligence markets, helping to identify innovative opportunities in key markets. She then went into business development for the company's industrial gas business in Materials & Energy markets as well as Waste/Water Treatments. Next, she joined the Air Liquide's Hydrogen Energy division as Product Manager of hydrogen stations for specialized vehicles and industrial fleets. Most recently, she was Senior Business Developer with responsibility for initiating mobile and stationary hydrogen applications development in Europe.

At McPhy, de Rosmini will be responsible for spearheading the development of strategic accounts in:

on-site industrial hydrogen

renewable energy via "power to gas"

hydrogen-based electro-mobility : infrastructure development for green hydrogen energy vehicles

McPhy Energy's core expertise is its innovative technology for storing hydrogen in a solid state (based on magnesium hydrides). Named as one of the Top 100 of worldwide eco-innovative companies, McPhy has accelerated its development in major industrial and environmental hydrogen-based projects and applications in Germany, Japan, California, England and France. Recent successes include participation in the energy transition of Berlin's Schönefeld airport, and the GDF Suez GRHYD power-to-gas project (hydrogen injection in the natural gas pipeline).

In brief - latest news from McPhy Energy:

March 2013: McPhy expands project team

January 2013: 10M€ capital increase completed by McPhy's historical investors

January 2013: McPhy announces acquisition of PIEL in Italy

December 2012: In Germany's energy transition, ITM Power selects McPhy technology for hydrogen storage

November 2012: McPhy Energy Takes Part in the GRHYD Project for French Gas Network

October 2012: for the third consecutive year, McPhy Energy is one of the top 100 worldwide eco-innovation companies

July 2012: McPhy joins consortium demonstrating high-density hydrogen storage in smart energy grids

July 2012 : McPhy Energy expands operations in Europe and appoints Roland Kaeppner as CEO for Germany

About McPhy Energy - http://www.mcphy.com Created south of Grenoble, France in 2008, McPhy Energy's mission is to industrialize and commercialize an innovative hydrogen storage technology using magnesium hydrides. Offering unique advantages compared with the other hydrogen storage solutions, this technology addresses the industrial hydrogen and renewable energy markets. McPhy Energy owns exclusive rights on a portfolio of patents, which result from over 8 years of research at CNRS, in partnership with Joseph Fourier University (France). A member of the TENERRDIS competitiveness cluster, McPhy Energy is involved as direct partner or subcontractor in several research projects. McPhy Energy is listed in the Global Cleantech 100 and the Top 5 Cleantech France. The company has recently signed numerous contracts in France, the United Kingdom, Germany, Italy and Japan, demonstrating its technological leadership.

Titre: Air Liquide faces P6 million lawsuit - Mmegi Online
Contenu:
Through his attorneys, Otto Itumeleng Law Chambers, Ntwaagae says that he was sacked though he did not breach his contract of employment and since his dismissal, he has not been paid his dues. He says the company has failed to reinstate him or pay the remaining balance of the contract price up to the time he would have retired. Ntwaagae entered into employment with Air Liquide on August 1, 2008 for an unspecific period. His attorneys says that the contract entitled him to a salary of P12,700 per month and that the increment was to be performance based. "As at the time of the termination of the plaintiff's employment, the plaintiff was drawing a salary in the sum of P28,200," states the court papers.

Ntwaagae was also entitled to a fixed yearly bonus equal to one month's basic salary payable in November on pro rata temporis (in proportion to the time he worked during the year). He was entitled to a 7.5 percent performance bonus calculated on the basis of his annual salary. His attorneys say the person who purported to terminate his contract had no authority to do so and the action contravened the company's own rules and conditions of service. "The defendant did not have a valid reason to dismiss the plaintiff and it failed to follow the correct procedure in conducting the disciplinary hearing against plaintiff. Plaintiff avers that defendant failed to pay him his annual performance bonus as provided for in the performance contract. Defendant was obliged to pay the performance bonus in November 2011," the attorneys say. It is alleged that the termination of employment was unlawful and wrongful and notwithstanding written and verbal demands, the company has not purged any of the incidences of breach. As a consequence of the unlawful and wrongful termination of the plaintiff's contract of employment, the company is liable to reinstate Ntwaagae and pay him the sum equivalent to his monthly salary from the date of dismissal (December 19, 2011) until reinstatement.

Titre: Authorities Order Destruction of 7 000 Rice Tons Imported From Burma - Business in Cameroon
Contenu:
(Business in Cameroon) - Essimi Menye, Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development last May 17, ordered the destruction of rice imported from the province of Myanmar (Burma). It was seized on May 9, 2013 at the Douala port on grounds of pest risks.

Signaled, a team of inspectors from a local laboratory on a second attempt in the rice vessel found traces of contamination and then localized the consignment.

On May 1st, 2013 Essimi Menye requested the services of three laboratories in Douala that of the University of Douala, Scienti-Labo and SGS. Results from all three concluded that the rice imported by Socia Sarl was improper for consumption.

The rice contained sodium chloride, high acidity level and traces of heavy metals. Reports say, the rice got contaminated as it was being transported due to a faulty ventilation system of the vessel.

Titre: CFAF 10 billion Gov’t Bonds on Sale May 8 - Business in Cameroon
Contenu:
A statement from Cameroon’s Treasury said, the Cameroon government will issue treasury bonds amounting to 10 billion francs CFA as from May 8, 2013 within the BEAC market- the same amount sought in early April, which saw bidders jostling at the gate.

According to the State Treasury, 42 billion francs CFA was proposed to the State of Cameroon at the last issuance at an interest rate of 1.4% only.

Cameroon began borrowing from the capital market in the BEAC zone in 2011 to finance scores of ongoing giant projects expected to transform the country’s economy. Since then, 100 billion francs CFA has already been paid by the State of Cameroon to holders of the 160 billion francs CFA bonds circulated in the bond market within the BEAC zone between 2011 and 2012.
